726EF51A3D404685A4274F0BF6B5B298.description:
Investigate and develop a model of early development which traces the changes
of a fertilized cell (zygote) through the blastocyst level of development and the then
gastrulation process resulting in the rise of the three primary germ layers.

F1E4D58877D546D596572B64E1BCD832.description:
Describe how spermatozoa move through the female reproductive tract and
describe the process of fertilization.

FFFCF06B7074402BABACF86F7501B737.description:
Create a model showing how fluctuating hormonal changes associated with the
reproductive system impact both the uterine and ovarian cycles.

BF010A0541424B19B29CC96A49C8EF61.description: Discuss the role of hormones in the reproductive system.

8D1BE966561F499C947A142D2E90517A.description:
Identify and locate major and accessory organs of the female and male
reproductive systems and discuss their functions.

4F5B93E9113648E199D8939A5A5E2515.description: Sandard 15: Life Cycle in the Human Body: The Reproductive System

A56A984DDF764AEEBC5D8DBB749C7D71.description:
Investigate how the kidneys respond to excess water intake and to dehydration,
as well as the role of antidiuretic hormone (ADH) and sodium in the regulation of water
absorption and excretion.

A335E8A62F214EE7A556BDF0A59ACFE5.description:
Explain the neural basis of micturition including the function of the sphincters
associated with the male and female urethra.

EA5F402B40D347AC918419BC25CE24F0.description:
Develop a model of the nephron which explores its structural components and
the functional processes of filtration, secretion, and reabsorption, which are essential to
maintaining homeostasis.

EFB8FBDE21F342169EACB68197B028FC.description:
Understand the function of the kidneys in relation to homeostatic control of
bodily fluids, blood pressure, and erythrocyte production.

DE4A9E197A184E8282BDE2150655F72F.description:
Identify and locate major organs of the urinary system and discuss their
functions.

53EBE85FD8444FD4A5AB3F9773AF00B6.description:
Standard 14: Absorption and
Excretion in the Human Body:
The Urinary System

731F5CBC37DB430A801E4D9860CCE79D.description:
Describe how the body monitors changes in blood pH and carbon dioxide
using specialized receptors and how the respiratory system adjusts in order to maintain
homeostasis.

3314C2CA8EF94D4B81B0EB601A4B20AB.description:
Investigate how percentages and partial pressure gradients of oxygen and
carbon dioxide impact net gas exchange.

FDDAD5B6C325489F8981D4E60AAC9A5E.description:
Investigate the anatomical structures and physiological processes involved in
inspiration & expiration.

63313B728EA542C892C569A74ED1DCB9.description:
Identify and locate major organs of the respiratory system and discuss their
functions.

9A44CE20794C4C1A99C1BCC2F95F1FCA.description:
Standard 13: Absorption and
Excretion in the Human Body: The
Respiratory System

11AEB05852084D549C120DA1D06EAA10.description: Explain the difference between metabolic and respiratory acidosis and alkalosis.

58F5CCD22AE74C6883F24043D39CB9B8.description:
Investigate the enzymes of the gastrointestinal tract and accessory organs in
relation to the processing, digesting, and absorbing of the three major biomolecules.

3FCCB831525D4A0083A09E1145AD6E8F.description:
Identify and locate major and accessory organs of the digestive system and
investigate their physiological functions.

2B755868982A4D7A9CBD0A4622DF6C2E.description: Standard 12: Absorption and Excretion in the Human Body: The Digestive System

ED6F752E429545EDAB0E25A72D6565C4.description:
Investigate the difference between innate and acquired immunity. Examine how
cellular and non-cellular components work collectively to defend the body against
foreign pathogens and how they contribute to maintaining homeostasis.

963D7F12CE3842EB800C6D82E6025A23.description:
Identify the primary structural components of the lymphatic system and their
functions. Analyze the relationship with activities of bone marrow, thymus gland, and
overall importance in maintaining homeostasis.

2128D13DA8E849A5854184F86FD2EC00.description:
Standard 11: Transport in the
Human Body: The Lymphatic
System and Immune Mechanisms

B23AAA1D8F5048208AA8DA7A89453F48.description:
Investigate how the cardiovascular system and other body systems respond to
changes in blood volume as well as changes in physical activity which allow the body to
maintain homeostasis.

EF86C1ECB0104520BF8D28D1D6852F51.description:
Discuss the regulation of blood pressure. Analyze the effect of abnormal blood
pressure on long term health.

795F3A56FFBB4DDAB263AFCB67DA3621.description:
Use a diagram and/or a model to illustrate the external and internal structures
and layers of the heart, the vessels entering and leaving the heart, and the one-way blood
flow through the heart.

670D7CE01E7144688B47C0EBF691900A.description:
Compare and contrast the structural and functional difference between the
different blood vessel types. Model what vasoconstriction and vasodilation are and how
they impact homeostasis.

0095DC9127834719A1252ECF29B7E93F.description: Investigate the stages, control, and regulation of the cardiac cycle.

7B0401C723BA4CEEB14615CEDABA5F7D.description:
Investigate the primary structures of the cardiovascular system and explore their
functional importance to maintaining homeostasis.

35314F17D69D45C7A88656CCB7D8B22C.description:
Standard 10: Transport in the Human Body:
The Cardiovascular System

53101F4B32184AD5A1EDFF2080D2D4EF.description:
Investigate the ABO blood types, antigens and antibodies, and their significance
in blood transfusion.

2CB0188F08004242998B01128B6F3AE9.description:
Evaluate the composition and functions of whole blood, plasma, and the
regulation and production of blood cells.

D1F84B8AEB594739B7E3D3FD7A70C05D.description:
Analyze and model the functions of blood which are fundamental to maintaining
homeostasis; including hemostasis; nutrient, gas, and waste exchange; and inflammatory
response.

BFCF19B2C37048EB8DC4461062A613A8.description: Standard 9: Transport in the Human Body: The Blood

DCF42A456EF9410A927C0B0B818695A6.description:
Investigate the endocrine and exocrine functions of the pancreas and its
involvement in digestion and blood sugar regulation.

91135BF6BA4D4E1AA2F33097D825CE6B.description:
Investigate the hormones of the hypothalamus-pituitary complex, the function of
these hormones in controlling the thyroid, gonads, and adrenal cortex; and the feedback
signals that control them. Evaluate how the HP complex, the sympathetic nervous
system, and the adrenal medulla are influenced by stress.

1DF58B57E4E5434E93D78100A96DEC7C.description:
Distinguish between amino acid, peptide, and lipid based hormones and describe
how they differ in bringing about changes in cellular activity.

02904F45468D4D18A90E283FAFB315DA.description:
Discuss the structural and functional
differences between an endocrine gland and an exocrine gland.

416021B3CB6D43C2BA392ADCDE2A3F5B.description:
Investigate the structure and function of the endocrine system and develop
models showing how changes in prominent hormone levels impact homeostasis
throughout the body systems.

DA5E97955DF44E8299FFE558635CA0B2.description:
Standard 8: Integration and Coordination
in the Human Body: The Endocrine
System

6AD0E48D2DA54342AC65AC365921BEAD.description:
Investigate the structural components and function of the ear, and model how
equilibrium and sound are detected through the ear.

F7BE383AB84E4CDCBB7CD045BA74E3F2.description:
Explore the anatomy of the eye, it's functional layers, the fovea and its function.
Investigate how the eye accommodates for near and distance vision as well as how the
eye adapts to changes in light.

47B7E070D38B4950815CE31319A9937D.description:
Distinguish between somatic senses and special senses, the prominent sensory
receptor types, and their functional operation.

A70ED352BDD84DA2A8AD833F0C029CF1.description:
Standard 7: Integration and
Coordination in the Human Body:
Somatic and Special Senses

E62A00E0E2AC443384D4862228298D15.description:
Identify and model how action potentials are generated, the ions and channel
protein involved, and the basic structural and functional aspects which allow for synaptic
connection.

77F20FE942A74C30857B32FDCD800FA1.description:
Compare and contrast the actions, origins, and pathways of nerve fibers in the
parasympathetic and sympathetic divisions of the autonomic nervous system and their
associated neurotransmitters.

EA34FB048A744A41A0BE073E37BE1193.description:
Describe and diagram the structures of the various types of neurons, their
supporting neuroglial cells, and investigate their basic functions.

780DB363AF2343A2856FA5BBE6AB226D.description:
Develop a model that illustrates the structural components and functional
subdivisions of the nervous system.

B398FCCE48D34CE3AF38C51592294DB0.description: Standard 6: Integration and Coordination in the Human Body: The Nervous System

4DFAE96491E34463948105E15CD03BE9.description:
Distinguish between isotonic and isometric contractions of skeletal muscle.
Examine muscular hypertrophy and atrophy and discuss causes of these processes.

BE9FA44AEA364230B892344C75F20C6C.description: Identify the major muscles on a diagram, model, or through dissection.

0B92B82782CF49849FA8A25949B10AB3.description:
Describe how a neuromuscular junction functions and investigate how motor
units influence the force and velocity of muscle contraction.

3C2FF4BA8F8B4C1D9EC6D5533EB94479.description:
Explain the molecular processes involved in the sliding filament model and
biochemical mechanisms that provide energy for muscle contraction and relaxation.

B97E4F0625FF4D8BA457618835065256.description:
Investigate the molecular components of skeletal muscle fiber and how they
function to bring about contraction and relaxation.

315AF4EC4E264E308A29AD6F6CB9B981.description:
Compare and contrast the structural and functional similarities and differences
between skeletal, cardiac, and smooth muscle.

1B96E0BE39DD40B5812DA1629CE656AA.description:
Standard 5: Movement and Support in the
Human Body: The Muscular System

B84B748C7E704BCF904946E0BE0CD2F2.description:
Identify and describe the structure of the major types of joints and how these
structural components influence functional mobility and stability.

DE549E4475F64DE7A67E9C55C2645168.description:
Evaluate the general macroscopic characteristics of a typical long bone, then
locate and identify individual bones and bone features.

D571791EF5634DD997AE672A9F088ADC.description:
Develop a model to illustrate the structure, development, growth, and function
of compact and spongy bone.

DD603BF079D047089A547402A1D90349.description:
Standard 4: Movement and
Support in the Human
Body: The Skeletal System

856D2F7EB8504A0098371FFAAF95004A.description:
Investigate the injuries, diseases, and causes associated with the integumentary
system and evaluate the consequences.

A69DEB7E6F2C485094390644B0199B7F.description:
Analyze the structural characteristics and functional importance of the
integumentary system to maintaining homeostasis of the body.

EC44F0657B8346338ABA6B65B4ADC8CF.description: Standard 3: Movement and Support in the Human Body: The Integumentary System

9ECAAA0B6A894F6EB4990B30193F86AB.description:
Identify anatomical terms (including body direction, regions, planes) on a
diagram, model, or through dissection.

B09625BA82824E42846E3F49F11E797B.description:
Identify the body cavities, their membranes, and the organs within each cavity.
Investigate the major organ systems and describe their basic functional importance.

7629416AA8DE4433BC034640D495B62C.description:
Investigate and be able to describe the histological structural and functional
characteristics of the four basic tissue types.

EF9A269F070045F1AF31C1B734057008.description:
Analyze how each hierarchical level of life contributes to complexity of anatomy
and physiological functions (e.g. cells, tissues, etc.). Investigate the relationships among
various tissue types as well as the molecular and cellular composition of these tissues.

135B50BB474B4101A7E0FA7FD93F141A.description: Standard 2: Levels of Organization in the Human Body: Tissue and Organs

F3CEC4E55553430B901B3DB6128E6857.description:
Explore the vital ways that proteins contribute to the structure, metabolism,
and defense of the body, as well as, the importance of shape to their function.

4A4274A551634C5BB0BFE4467132828E.description: Introduce the basic step and control mechanisms of protein synthesis.

D8054B64C2374C2CBAF6F202485C0FA9.description:
Explore the homeostatic range to sustaining human life, the principal mechanism
involved, and predict the consequences of what happens when homeostasis is not
maintained.

DDB2C4BEA4874FF69A962DB690D06D16.description:
Develop a model which describes the stages of somatic cell division (mitosis),
how it contributes to maintaining homeostasis, and why cellular differentiation is vital to
development.

326EC4A86FF04A2B919F0122AF06D16A.description:
Investigate the forms of cellular transport within and across cell membranes.
Explain how passive and active transport move materials through the body and into/out
of cells. Describe the how simple diffusion differs from facilitated diffusion. Describe
how vesicular transport moves materials within a cell.

4E88C2F712994F319764A4363C4F155A.description: Standard 1: Levels of Organization in the Human Body: Cellular
